item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch Toronto Blue Jays baseball on TV with our guide, featuring game times, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In professional sports, few things are more frustrating than unfulfilled potential, and Toronto Blue Jays fans have felt that sting more than once in recent years. Despite a talented core and multiple playoff appearances from 2015 to 2023, the team never managed to make a deep postseason run. Big expectations often turned into big letdowns.

Then came 2025, and the Blue Jays turned out to be one of the best teams in the Show.

Toronto won 94 games and earned a spot in the American League Divisional Series. The Blue Jays will play the winner of the Wild Card series between the Boston Red Sox and New York Yankees.

If you’re a Toronto fan who’s been itching to see if the Blue Jays can make a deep playoff run this year, I’ll show you how you can catch every playoff game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Blue Jays channels
  • Toronto Blue Jays TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Blue Jays TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Blue Jays games?

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., Toronto Blue Jays games are available out-of-market via MLB.TV, since U.S. viewers don’t fall within the Canadian blackout territory.

Nationally televised games (on channels like ESPN, FOX, FS1, and TBS) are available to U.S. fans via live TV providers or streaming services. But MLB.TV doesn’t include those live broadcasts.

How to watch in Canada

In Canada, the Toronto Blue Jays are exclusively broadcast through Sportsnet and its related feeds like Sportsnet One and Sportsnet 360. The network covers nearly every game throughout the regular season and postseason.

For French-speaking fans, TVA Sports (via a sub-licensing arrangement with Sportsnet) carries French-language broadcasts of Blue Jays games and some national MLB content in Canada.

Occasional Friday night Blue Jays games are exclusive to Apple TV+, which aren’t available through Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.

Want radio coverage? The Blue Jays’ flagship radio station is Sportsnet 590 The Fan (CJCL AM 590) in Toronto, with coverage available across southern Ontario. It simulcasts most games and is carried on satellite and digital platforms.

2025 Toronto Blue Jays playoff TV schedule

The Blue Jays finished in first place in the AL East this season. They’ll put that gaudy record to the test in the best-of-five Divisional Series starting Saturday, October 4.

Below is the full schedule for the ALDS as it’s currently known. I’ll update it as soon as more information comes out.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Blue Jays

Canada: Score a standalone in-market TV package for Blue Jays games

If you’re a local fan in Canada who wants to stream games without a cable package, Sportsnet+ is your best bet. A subscription gives you access to nearly every regular-season Blue Jays game that isn’t nationally televised. Once subscribed, you can watch online or via the Sportsnet app on your preferred device.

Just don’t forget to add Apple TV+ to your setup if you want to catch the exclusive Friday Night Baseball games, which often feature the Blue Jays. That applies to fans in both Canada and the U.S.

United States: Get MLB.TV and a live TV service

For U.S.-based fans looking to watch the Toronto Blue Jays throughout the 2025 season, the most complete and convenient setup is a combination of MLB.TV and a live TV streaming service.

MLB.TV is the best way to watch nearly every Blue Jays game, since they’re considered an out-of-market team in the U.S. This means you can stream all regular-season games live or on demand, with the exception of those that air nationally on channels like ESPN or FOX.

To cover those national broadcasts, services like Fubo, DIRECTV, or Sling TV are your best bets.

  • Fubo: A top choice for sports fans, Fubo offers access to ESPN, FOX, FS1, and more, along with the option to integrate your MLB.TV subscription directly into the platform for a seamless viewing experience.
  • DIRECTV: DIRECTV’s streaming option also offers full access to national channels and supports MLB.TV as an add-on, making it a solid traditional alternative.
  • Sling TV: For a more budget-friendly approach, Sling TV with both the Orange and Blue packages plus the Sports Extra add-on gives you access to ESPN, TBS, FS1, and MLB Network. Keep in mind you’ll need to manage MLB.TV separately.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Blue Jays FAQ

How can I watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free?

To watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free, your best bet is to sign up for a Sportsnet+ free trial in Canada, or a Fubo or DIRECTV free trial in the U.S. for nationally televised games. You can also check MLB.TVs Free Game of the Day, which occasionally features the Blue Jays at no cost.

How can American viewers watch the Blue Jays most effectively?

In the U.S., the best way to watch the Blue Jays is with MLB.TV, which includes nearly every out-of-market game. Pair it with Apple TV+ for Friday exclusives and a live TV service (like Fubo or Sling TV) for games on ESPN, FOX, FS1, or MLB Network. This combo ensures full-season coverage.

Why should American fans care about the only MLB team north of the border?

The Blue Jays feature a star-studded lineup with names like Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Bo Bichette, plus theyre constant playoff contenders. Their games often feature thrilling matchups against top AL East rivalsand the newly renovated Rogers Centre is one of baseballs most unique ballparks.

Why you should trust us

As an Ontario resident, lifelong Blue Jays fan, and a Sportsnet subscriber who also has Apple TV+ for the Friday games, I understand firsthand the challenges of navigating MLB broadcast options.

I’ve used that experience to make this guide as helpful and practical as possible for fellow Jays fans.

I created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Toronto Blue Jays fans in mind.

After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Blue Jays’ 2025 season, I determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out CableTV.com’s How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
Will this season be a home run for the Mariners? Learn how to watch Seattle Mariners baseball with our guide, featuring their TV schedule and channel lineup.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
How hard is it to make the MLB playoffs when you play in the American League? Just ask the Seattle Mariners. Since 2001, they’ve had 11 winning seasons. Yet only one of those led to a playoff appearance.

But the Mariners managed to make 2025 a successful season after qualifying for the American League Divisional Series. They start play Saturday, October 4 against the winner of the Wild Card series between the Detroit Tigers and Cleveland Guardians.

Even though the matchup and times of the ALDS are yet to be announced, I’ve put together a watch guide for this round of the playoffs and beyond with what we know so far. Keep checking back on this page as more information becomes available.

Jump to:

  • Seattle Mariners channels
  • Best ways to watch the Mariners
  • Seattle Mariners TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Seattle Mariners games?

ROOT SPORTS is the regional home for Seattle Mariners broadcasts in 2025. Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, MLB Network, and The Roku Channel will also televise a handful of Mariners games.

Out-of-market fans who want to watch regional broadcasts this year will need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to do so.

Want radio coverage? The Mariners Radio Network offers listening options to fans in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Alaska, and British Columbia. Fans in those states and Montana can also listen to games on the Seattle Sports 710 AM app or the Seattle Sports website.

Spanish-language audio is available for all Mariners home games through SAP channels on most of the cable and satellite providers that carry the ROOT SPORTS channel.

Best TV plans for watching the Seattle Mariners

Mariners fans in the Pacific Northwest have two excellent viewing options for the 2025 MLB season: a direct-to-consumer (DTC) package or a standard TV provider. I’ll go over the positives of each to help make your viewing decision easier.

ROOT SPORTS Stream ($19.99/mo.)

If you think you need a cable or satellite subscription to watch the Mariners on TV in 2025, think again. ROOT SPORTS Stream—the exclusive DTC viewing option for local fans—broadcasts almost every game the Mariners will play this season. The monthly price is unbeatable, and you can watch games on the app or online while traveling outside the Mariners’ TV market for up to 30 days. This is what I call a winning deal!

Fubo ($14.99$94.99/mo.)

Not many TV providers carry ROOT SPORTS in their channel lineup. Luckily, Fubo does. If you’re an in-market fan, all you need is a good internet connection and a compatible device to subscribe.

The main drawback to watching local Mariners games on a TV provider is the regional sports fee, and Fubo isn’t very transparent about this extra cost. Aside from that, there’s a lot to like about Fubo, including its unlimited recording capabilities. That comes in handy during a 162-game season.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers

2025 Seattle Mariners TV schedule

The Mariners kicked off the season with a home win in front of 42,871 passionate fans. Although it took until early April to win their first series, they’ve been playing solid baseball ever since, and earned a spot in the ALDS.

This best-of-five series should be exciting. Check out the full schedule below.

How to watch the Seattle Mariners FAQ

Can I watch the Seattle Mariners for free?

Yes, you can watch the Seattle Mariners for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on channels like FOX. Check out the FCCs Reception Map Tool to find the channels that are available where you live.

Is ROOT SPORTS a regional sports network?

Yes, ROOT SPORTS is a regional sports network that provides coverage to fans in Washington, Oregon, Montana, Alaska, and parts of Idaho.

What channel is ROOT SPORTS on?

The channel that ROOT SPORTS is on depends on your TV provider and your location. Use the ROOT SPORTS Channel Finder tool to see which channel you can watch Mariners games on.

Where can I download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app?

You can download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app on Apple and Android devices, as well as several other streaming platforms and smart TVs.

Are the Mariners playing on Sunday Night Baseball in 2025?

Yes, the Mariners are playing on ESPNs Sunday Night Baseball in 2025. Theyll be facing the Mets in the MLB Little League Classic on Sunday, August 17.

Why you should trust us

I created this watch guide after nearly four hours of research into the Seattle Mariners’ 2025 broadcast schedule. It includes every channel the Mariners will play on this MLB season, ways to watch the team, their full regular-season schedule, and a detailed FAQ section.

Learn more about CableTV.com’s methods by checking out our How We Rank page.

item.title: Every New Title Coming to Hulu, Disney+, and ABC for Huluween 2025
item.dc:creator: Olivia Bono
item.description:
Hulus annual Halloween content hub is a candy bowl of new shows and movies for Halloween aficionados.

The post Every New Title Coming to Hulu, Disney+, and ABC for Huluween 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch on Hulu

Huluween is to Hulu as Bloodstream is to CableTV.com. While our spooky-season campaign features horror movie recommendations and trivia, Hulu’s annual Halloween content hub is a candy bowl of new shows and movies for Halloween aficionados.

What new titles can you expect from Hulu, Disney+, and ABC this October? Keep reading to find out.

Watch free anime this October

Hulu has a great selection of anime, but you can find even more on Crunchyroll. Crunchyroll offers an impressive library of free (with ads) titles, and is adding a number of spooky titles to that list for the month of October. Don’t miss out!

The complete Huluween 2025 schedule is all tricks and treats

Huluween titles are available to all Hulu subscribers. When it comes to Hulu plans, it’s mostly a matter of whether you want to avoid those pesky ads—and if you’d prefer to bundle with Disney+.

Since Disney+ and Hulu are corporate besties, Disney Bundle subscribers can also watch Hulu content through Disney+’s interface.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Before the NHL regular season begins, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting in September. We dusted off our skates to deliver a complete look at how to watch this years NHL preseason.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Before the puck drops on the 2025–2026 NHL regular season, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting September 20, 2025. NHL Network and TNT will televise select games nationwide, but most preseason hockey action airs on regional sports networks (RSNs).

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite service for catching the NHL preseason. It comes with every national NHL channel and offers most RSNs based on your location. But if you support a team far from home, you’ll want ESPN+ for out-of-market streaming access.

Keep reading for more info on NHL preseason channels and recommended TV services. We also have a section dedicated to the full preseason schedule so you can quickly check game times.

Jump to:

  • NHL preseason channels
  • NHL preseason TV schedule
  • Best NHL preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NHL preseason for free

Don’t miss preseason hockey on TV!

Score the best TV plan in your area by entering your zip code below.

What channels are NHL preseason games on?

NHL preseason channels are a bit of a mixed bag. Most games air locally on regional sports networks or stream with geo-restrictions on each team’s official website. NHL Network and TNT broadcast some matchups nationwide, and you can stream many out-of-market preseason games on ESPN+.

Want radio coverage? While not all NHL preseason games appear on TV, you can listen to game audio through team radio affiliates online via TuneIn.

2025 NHL preseason schedule

This year’s NHL preseason runs from September 21 to October 5. Like previous seasons, the two-week period includes neutral-site exhibition games happening domestically and internationally. Buffalo Sabres fans in Germany will get a special treat as the NHL Global Series makes a preseason stop at SAP Garden in Munich.

Best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason

The best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason depend on the games you wish to see. If you prefer having access to every preseason duel, you’ll want DIRECTV STREAM and ESPN+.

DIRECTV STREAM will get you every national NHL channel and your regional sports network, while ESPN+ provides out-of-market access. Together, DIRECTV STREAM with a standalone ESPN+ subscription is the most expensive route for NHL fans. It’s also unnecessary if you want only the televised games featuring your favorite team. In that case, you may look to one of these options:

  1. Local games: Watching locally televised NHL preseason games is tricky because every team has different TV affiliates. In most cases, you’ll need a TV provider like DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo to get RSN access. Otherwise, depending on your local team’s broadcaster, a simple TV antenna can pick up games over the air.
  2. Out-of-market games: ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice carry out-of-market NHL games. You won’t get every out-of-market preseason game because not every game airs on TV, but ESPN+ is a great streaming option for only $10.99 a month.
  3. National games: Sling TV is the cheapest way to get national NHL channels like ESPN, NHL Network, and TNT. All you’ll need is the Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and the Sports Extra add-on ($11.00/mo.).

Which TV providers carry NHL preseason games?

Any TV plan offering NHL Network and TNT will get you nationally televised NHL preseason games. To help your search, we listed 13 popular TV services in the table below and illustrated whether they carry the two channels.

How to watch the NHL preseason for free

Unfortunately, no straightforward viewing methods exist to watch NHL preseason games for free. In some metropolitan areas with NHL teams, you might catch a few matchups using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna—such as KMCC in Las Vegas airing Vegas Golden Knights preseason games. However, this option is not viable for most NHL fans, especially if you don’t live near your favorite team.

While scouring Reddit for free NHL streams is possible, we don’t endorse that approach due to its illegality, unreliability, and potential risks to your streaming device. Instead, a legitimate and inexpensive option is subscribing to ESPN+ at $11.99 a month, which will provide access to many matchups with no additional commitments.

Are all NHL preseason games on TV?

Most NHL preseason games appear on TV or online, although some matchups may not have an official broadcast. Regional blackout restrictions can also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

For in-market coverage, you’ll need a TV plan with your local team’s regional sports network. You can also explore out-of-market options like ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice if you support a non-local team. In cases where no viewing option is available, games are typically still accessible through each team’s radio partner.

How to watch the NHL preseason FAQ

Can you stream NHL preseason games?

Yes, you can stream NHL preseason games on any live TV streaming service that offers NHL Network, TNT, and your local teams RSN affiliate. ESPN+ also carries select out-of-market games during the preseason.

Are NHL preseason games blacked out?

Yes, broadcasting blackouts occur for all locally televised NHL preseason games. In-market games will appear on RSNs, while ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice will show some out-of-market matchups.

Does NHL Center Ice include preseason games?

Yes, NHL Center Ice carries select out-of-market preseason games. Unlike the regular season, NHL Center Ice doesnt offer complete out-of-market access during the preseason. Blackout restrictions may also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

Where can I watch NHL preseason games in Canada?

In Canada, some NHL preseason games air nationally on Sportsnet, Sportsnet ONE, and TSN. Sportsnet+ (formerly Sportsnet NOW) will show select out-of-market preseason games, while in-market games may appear on TSNs regional networks and individual team websites.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, conducted thorough research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch this year’s NHL preseason. He compiled a comprehensive list of preseason matchups and channel listings. Utilizing that data, he compared popular TV providers to determine the most efficient way to watch the most games—considering in-market, out-of-market, and nationally televised broadcasts.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the Detroit Red Wings: 20252026 Season TV Guide

Dont miss a single moment of the 20252026 Detroit Red Wings season. Our guide includes the complete TV schedule and best streaming options for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the Detroit Red Wings: 20252026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Detroit Red Wings have spent years in rebuild mode, but the tide may finally be turning. Captain Dylan Larkin leads a maturing core, Moritz Seider anchors the blue line, Lucas Raymond looks ready for a breakout, and newcomer John Gibson adds stability in goal. In Hockeytown, there’s growing belief the long playoff drought could soon end.

I’ve followed the Wings through both glory years and lean seasons, and one thing’s clear: keeping up with every game on TV can be tricky. That’s because broadcast rights are split between regional networks, national channels, and streaming platforms. This guide cuts through the clutter, so whether you’re watching from Michigan, across the U.S., or in Canada, you’ll know exactly where to find every puck drop.

From FanDuel Sports Network Detroit’s local coverage to national broadcasts on ESPN and TNT, I’ll walk you through the best ways to follow the Red Wings. I even outline my picks for the most reliable and cost-effective TV setup.

Jump to:

  • Detroit Red Wings channels
  • Detroit Red Wings TV schedule

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Detroit Red Wings games?

In the U.S., most Red Wings games air locally on FanDuel Sports Network Detroit (FDSDET). Out-of-market fans can catch those same regular-season games on ESPN+, which streams all matchups not shown nationally.

National broadcasts appear on ESPN, TNT, ABC, and occasionally NHL Network. To watch these, you’ll need a live TV service that carries each channel, such as DIRECTV, Hulu + Live TV, or YouTube TV.

Want radio coverage? The Red Wings’ flagship radio station is 97.1 The Ticket (WXYT-FM) in Detroit, which broadcasts all regular-season and playoff games.

Red Wings channels for Canadian fans

In Canada, games against Canadian opponents are usually carried on Sportsnet or TSN, with many U.S. national broadcasts simulcast on Canadian networks. Sportsnet+ offers live streaming for most games shown on Sportsnet, while RDS provides Canadian French–language coverage for select matchups.

2025–2026 Detroit Red Wings TV schedule

From October’s Opening Night at Little Caesars Arena to the final push for a playoff spot in April, every game will be part of Detroit’s comeback story. The big question is, can they finally squash the longest playoff drought in franchise history?

Best TV plans for watching the Ottawa Senators

When it comes to watching the Senators on TV, there are two completely different sets of rules: one for fans in Canada and another for fans in the U.S. To make it simple, I’ve broken down my top viewing recommendations for each country below.

Senators coverage in Canada

In my experience, the best all-around setup for Senators fans in Canada is to pair a TSN subscription with access to Sportsnet for national games. That way, you’re covered for every regular-season matchup without having to hunt for streams or deal with blackout headaches.

If you prefer streaming, TSN+ offers a monthly or annual subscription for English-language regional broadcasts, while RDS Direct provides the same games in French. Both services work on most devices, and getting a Sportsnet+ subscription means you’ll be fully covered for Hockey Night in Canada and other national broadcasts.

It’s a simple, reliable combo that makes it easy to flip on the TV—or open the app—knowing you won’t miss a shift.

Senators channels for American fans

For U.S.-based Sens fans, the best all-in-one option is Hulu + Live TV. It includes ESPN+ for those out-of-market Senators games, plus TNT, ABC, and ESPN for nationally televised matchups. This bundled approach saves you from juggling multiple subscriptions and makes sure you won’t miss a game.

If you’re a multi-sport fan wanting a more cable-like channel lineup, DIRECTV is an excellent alternative. It carries the same national NHL channels as Hulu + Live TV, but with stronger regional sports coverage for in-market MLB, NBA, and NHL games. DIRECTV regularly offers free streaming trials, which is a nice perk for testing the service before committing.

How to watch the Ottawa Senators for free

If you’re hoping to catch the Sens without opening your wallet, there are a few options worth trying. In Canada, your best bet is to sign up for a TSN+ or Sportsnet+ free trial when available. Some nationally televised games on CBC and Citytv can also be streamed for free through their websites or apps.

In the U.S., services like Hulu + Live TV and DIRECTV occasionally offer free trials, giving you temporary access to national broadcasts on ESPN, TNT, ABC, and NHL Network. You can also stream out-of-market games for free if they happen to be featured on ESPN’s promotional nights or during special events like the NHL Global Series.

Free viewing options are usually limited and short-lived, but they’re a handy way to sample different services before committing for the season. Just don’t expect to rely on them to follow the Sens all year long.

How to watch the Ottawa Senators FAQ

How can I watch the Ottawa Senators if I dont live in Ontario?

If you live outside the Senators regional broadcast zone, the easiest way to watch most games is with a Sportsnet+ Premium subscription in Canada. National games also air on Sportsnet, CBC, or Citytv. For fans in the U.S., the go-to service for out-of-market NHL games is ESPN+, with national matchups appearing on ABC, ESPN, and TNT.

Can I stream Senators games without cable?

Yes, you can stream regional Senators games through TSN+ or RDS Direct in Canada. Meanwhile, national matchups are on Sportsnet+ or CBC Gem. In the U.S., an ESPN+ subscription is your key to streaming nearly every out-of-market Senators game.

Why is the Senators game blacked out?

A TV blackout means the Senators game is airing exclusively on another channel in your area. It usually happens for one of three reasons:

  • You live in the Senators region: The game is on the teams local channel (TSN5).
  • The Senators are playing your local team: The game is on your local teams regional sports network (e.g., NESN in Boston, MSG in New York).
  • You live out-of-market: The game was picked up for an exclusive national broadcast on a channel like TNT (in the U.S.) or Sportsnet (in Canada).

Are the Ottawa Senators a good team?

The Ottawa Senators arent just promising anymoretheyre proven. After years of building, the 20242025 squad broke through to the Stanley Cup Playoffs, finishing 45307 and just one point behind the eventual back-to-back champion Florida Panthers. That kind of season fuels confidence, and GM Steve Staios has every reason to believe his roster is close to complete. Deadline additions Dylan Cozens and Fabian Zetterlund, plus Jordan Spence from the draft, helped spark a 1452 run to close the seasonthe NHLs second-best record over that stretch. That locked up the final Eastern Conference wild card spot with ease. So, if last spring was a test drive, this season could be when Ottawa finally takes the wheeland floors it.

Why you should trust us

This guide comes from the firsthand experience of CableTV.com contributor Ian McLaren. As an Ontario-based hockey writer who grew up in Ottawa, he knows the challenges of following a small-market team nestled between Toronto and Montreal.

To create this guide, Ian compared TV and streaming platforms to help fans find the most consistent and affordable ways to follow their team. Before publishing, he carefully reviewed the 2025–2026 NHL broadcast lineup to ensure Sens fans get the most accurate viewing info available.

Our entire team is committed to this level of detail, and you can learn more about our methods on our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

item.content:encoded:
As one of the most storied franchises in professional sports, the Montreal Canadiens carry a legacy few teams can match. With 24 Stanley Cup banners hanging at the Bell Centre, Habs fans know both the weight of history and the excitement of a new generation trying to live up to it.

After a rebuilding stretch focused on developing young talent like Cole Caufield, Juraj Slafkovský, and captain Nick Suzuki, the Canadiens enter the 2025–2026 NHL season with growing optimism. Montreal also took a big swing this past July by acquiring defenseman Noah Dobson in a blockbuster trade with the New York Islanders.

Following an earlier-than-expected playoff berth in 2025, every game now feels like another step toward a brighter future. Whether you’re in Montreal or cheering from afar, here’s how to tune in all season long.

Jump to:

  • Montreal Canadiens channels
  • Montreal Canadiens TV schedule
  • Best Montreal Canadiens TV plans
  • Watch Montreal Canadiens for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Montreal Canadiens games?

How to watch in the United States

If you’re a Habs fan living south of the border, the best way to watch out-of-market games is with ESPN+. It carries all non-nationally televised NHL matchups through the league’s U.S. streaming partnership.

For games that air nationally on ABC, ESPN, or TNT, you’ll need a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV, Sling TV, Hulu + Live TV, YouTube TV, or Fubo to complete your setup.

How to watch in Canada

In Quebec and much of Eastern Canada, RDS (French) and TSN2 (English) are your go-to channels for regional Canadiens coverage. RDS holds exclusive Canadian French–language rights, while TSN2 carries select English-language games depending on your location.

For national broadcasts—including Hockey Night in Canada—tune into Sportsnet, CBC, or Citytv, which feature marquee Canadiens matchups throughout the season.

You can stream these games using RDS Direct or TSN+ for regional broadcasts, or Sportsnet+ for national coverage.

Want radio coverage? Tune into TSN 690 AM in Montreal for English-language radio broadcasts and 98.5 FM for French coverage. Both stations also stream online and through mobile apps.

2025 Montreal Canadiens TV schedule

From a trio of Original Six road games in Toronto, Detroit, and Chicago to kick off the season, to marquee matchups against the Bruins and Lightning, the Canadiens’ 2025–2026 schedule is packed with must-watch moments.

Here’s the full Canadiens TV schedule, complete with start times and channel listings.

Best TV plans for watching the Montreal Canadiens

The best way to watch the Canadiens depends on where you’re tuning in from. To help you catch every game, I’ve broken down the best TV plans for fans in both Canada and the U.S.

Canadiens coverage in Canada

If you’re in Quebec or other parts of Eastern Canada, you’ll want a provider that includes RDS (for Canadian French–language broadcasts) and TSN2 (for select English-language regional games). Both channels are available through most major cable providers, as well as streaming platforms like RDS Direct or TSN+.

Nationally televised games require access to Sportsnet, CBC, or Citytv. These networks air marquee Canadiens matchups across Canada and are accessible through Sportsnet+, traditional cable, and live TV streaming services like Fubo (in supported regions).

Canadiens channels for American fans

The Canadiens have a passionate fanbase that extends far beyond Canada’s borders. If you’re watching from the U.S., ESPN+ is your go-to for out-of-market Canadiens games. It gives you access to over 1,000 NHL matchups each season—including most regular-season Habs games that aren’t nationally televised.

For games airing exclusively on ABC, ESPN, TNT, or NHL Network, you’ll need a live TV service. I typically recommend DIRECTV for its comprehensive NHL coverage, but Hulu + Live TV is actually the stronger choice for Canadiens fans in the U.S. It’s cheaper and bundles in ESPN+ for all those out-of-market games. The only trade-off is that you won’t get NHL Network, but for following one specific team, it’s a better value.

Find the best TV provider in your area

Want to explore TV providers specific to your area? Enter your zip code below to see your options.

How to watch the Montreal Canadiens for free

While you won’t be able to watch every Canadiens game for free, a bit of planning can help you stream several matchups at no cost—at least temporarily.

Keep an eye on CBC, which broadcasts select Canadiens games on Hockey Night in Canada. These Saturday night matchups are free to stream live on CBC Gem—no subscription required. CBC is also available for free over the air with a digital antenna if you live near one of its few affiliate stations.

In the U.S., your best bet is to sign up for a free trial with a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV, Fubo, or YouTube TV. These platforms carry national sports channels such as ESPN, ABC, and TNT, which air select Canadiens games throughout the season.

Free trials typically last five to seven days—enough to catch a few key matchups if you time it right. ESPN+ also runs occasional promotions, especially when bundled with Disney+ and Hulu, making it a solid low-cost option for streaming out-of-market games.

How to watch the Montreal Canadiens FAQ

How can I watch the Montreal Canadiens if I dont live in Quebec?

In the U.S., ESPN+ is your best option for streaming every out-of-market Canadiens regular-season game. In Canada, fans outside of Quebec can catch games on TSN, RDS, or Sportsnet, depending on their region and language preference.

Can I stream Canadiens games without cable?

Yes, Canadian fans can use RDS Direct, TSN+, or Sportsnet+ to stream games online. In the U.S., the best combo is ESPN+ for out-of-market games and a live TV service like Hulu + Live TV or Sling TV for national broadcasts.

Whats the best way to watch every Canadiens game?

Youll likely need more than one service. In Canada, that means combining RDS or TSN for regional coverage with Sportsnet for national games. U.S. fans should use Hulu + Live TV, which includes ESPN+, to catch every out-of-market and nationally televised matchup.

Why should I watch the Canadiens this season?

The Canadiens are one of hockeys most iconic franchisesand they're finally turning the corner. With rising stars like Nick Suzuki, Cole Caufield, and Juraj Slafkovsk, plus the blockbuster addition of Noah Dobson, Montreal is blending its historic legacy with an exciting, fast-paced future. After a surprise playoff run last season, theyre aiming even higher in 20252026.

Why you should trust us

As someone who’s covered the NHL for nearly 20 years, I know how tough it can be to keep up with all 32 teams—especially in the streaming era, with regional blackouts and ever-changing platforms. This guide is built on firsthand experience navigating and comparing TV and streaming services to help fans find the most consistent and affordable ways to watch their team.

The Canadiens are going to draw more national attention this season—and honestly, the NHL is just better when Montreal is competitive. Even as a non-fan, I want to know who they’re playing and when. That’s how compelling this team has become. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed the 2025–2026 NHL broadcast lineup to ensure Canadiens fans get the most accurate, up-to-date viewing info available.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Ottawa Senators: 20252026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch the Ottawa Senators all season long with our complete viewing guide, featuring TV channels, streaming options, and the full 20252026 schedule.

The post How To Watch the Ottawa Senators: 20252026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In case you haven’t been paying attention—and no shame if you’ve been sleeping on the upstart squad in Canada’s capital—the Ottawa Senators have quietly amassed some of the top young talent in the NHL today. With Tim Stützle’s dynamic playmaking, Brady Tkachuk’s gritty leadership, and Jake Sanderson’s poised two-way game, Ottawa is building a core that’s as exciting as it is promising.

The Senators put up a decent fight against the longtime rival Toronto Maple Leafs in the Stanley Cup Playoffs this past spring. Now, with veteran goaltender Linus Ullmark locked in and more comfortable entering his second season with the club, just making the postseason won’t be enough—Ottawa is aiming for a deeper run.

Whether you’re looking for every in-market broadcast, need a streaming solution for out-of-market games, or just want to catch marquee national matchups, this guide breaks down every way to follow the Sens from puck drop to the final horn.

Jump to:

  • Ottawa Senators channels
  • Ottawa Senators TV schedule
  • Best Ottawa Senators TV plans
  • Watch Ottawa Senators for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Ottawa Senators games?

In Canada, Ottawa Senators regional broadcasts are split between TSN and RDS. TSN holds the English-language regional rights, with most games airing on TSN5 for viewers in Eastern Ontario, Quebec, and Atlantic Canada. RDS provides Canadian French–language coverage for fans across Quebec and other French-speaking regions.

Nationally televised Senators games air on Sportsnet, Sportsnet ONE, CBC, and Citytv as part of the NHL’s national broadcast deal. Saturday night games on Hockey Night in Canada are available in both English (Sportsnet/CBC) and French (Ici Radio-Canada Télé).

Want radio coverage? The Senators’ flagship radio station is TSN 1200 Ottawa, which carries live play-by-play of every regular-season and postseason game. Meanwhile, Canadian French–language broadcasts are available on 94.5 Unique FM in the Ottawa–Gatineau region.

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., most Senators games are considered out-of-market. To watch these, you have two main options: the ESPN+ streaming service or the NHL Center Ice add-on package for cable and satellite TV. Both will get you nearly every regular-season game.

The remaining games are national matchups, which you’ll find on channels like ABC, ESPN, TNT, and NHL Network. These games are typically available through any standard cable, satellite, or live TV streaming package.

2025–2026 Ottawa Senators TV schedule

With a young, fast, and fearless roster, the Ottawa Senators are must-watch hockey this season. Every game offers a chance to see Tim Stützle’s highlight-reel plays, Brady Tkachuk’s physical dominance, and Jake Sanderson’s steady presence on the blue line. Rivalry matchups with Toronto, Florida, and Montreal add extra intensity, making them must-see TV.

Keep this TV schedule handy so you know exactly when and where to catch the action all season long.

Best TV plans for watching the Ottawa Senators

When it comes to watching the Senators on TV, there are two completely different sets of rules: one for fans in Canada and another for fans in the U.S. To make it simple, I’ve broken down my top viewing recommendations for each country below.

Senators coverage in Canada

In my experience, the best all-around setup for Senators fans in Canada is to pair a TSN subscription with access to Sportsnet for national games. That way, you’re covered for every regular-season matchup without having to hunt for streams or deal with blackout headaches.

If you prefer streaming, TSN+ offers a monthly or annual subscription for English-language regional broadcasts, while RDS Direct provides the same games in French. Both services work on most devices, and getting a Sportsnet+ subscription means you’ll be fully covered for Hockey Night in Canada and other national broadcasts.

It’s a simple, reliable combo that makes it easy to flip on the TV—or open the app—knowing you won’t miss a shift.

Senators channels for American fans

For U.S.-based Sens fans, the best all-in-one option is Hulu + Live TV. It includes ESPN+ for those out-of-market Senators games, plus TNT, ABC, and ESPN for nationally televised matchups. This bundled approach saves you from juggling multiple subscriptions and makes sure you won’t miss a game.

If you’re a multi-sport fan wanting a more cable-like channel lineup, DIRECTV is an excellent alternative. It carries the same national NHL channels as Hulu + Live TV, but with stronger regional sports coverage for in-market MLB, NBA, and NHL games. DIRECTV regularly offers free streaming trials, which is a nice perk for testing the service before committing.

How to watch the Ottawa Senators for free

If you’re hoping to catch the Sens without opening your wallet, there are a few options worth trying. In Canada, your best bet is to sign up for a TSN+ or Sportsnet+ free trial when available. Some nationally televised games on CBC and Citytv can also be streamed for free through their websites or apps.

In the U.S., services like Hulu + Live TV and DIRECTV occasionally offer free trials, giving you temporary access to national broadcasts on ESPN, TNT, ABC, and NHL Network. You can also stream out-of-market games for free if they happen to be featured on ESPN’s promotional nights or during special events like the NHL Global Series.

Free viewing options are usually limited and short-lived, but they’re a handy way to sample different services before committing for the season. Just don’t expect to rely on them to follow the Sens all year long.

How to watch the Ottawa Senators FAQ

How can I watch the Ottawa Senators if I dont live in Ontario?

If you live outside the Senators regional broadcast zone, the easiest way to watch most games is with a Sportsnet+ Premium subscription in Canada. National games also air on Sportsnet, CBC, or Citytv. For fans in the U.S., the go-to service for out-of-market NHL games is ESPN+, with national matchups appearing on ABC, ESPN, and TNT.

Can I stream Senators games without cable?

Yes, you can stream regional Senators games through TSN+ or RDS Direct in Canada. Meanwhile, national matchups are on Sportsnet+ or CBC Gem. In the U.S., an ESPN+ subscription is your key to streaming nearly every out-of-market Senators game.

Why is the Senators game blacked out?

A TV blackout means the Senators game is airing exclusively on another channel in your area. It usually happens for one of three reasons:

  • You live in the Senators region: The game is on the teams local channel (TSN5).
  • The Senators are playing your local team: The game is on your local teams regional sports network (e.g., NESN in Boston, MSG in New York).
  • You live out-of-market: The game was picked up for an exclusive national broadcast on a channel like TNT (in the U.S.) or Sportsnet (in Canada).

Are the Ottawa Senators a good team?

The Ottawa Senators arent just promising anymoretheyre proven. After years of building, the 20242025 squad broke through to the Stanley Cup Playoffs, finishing 45307 and just one point behind the eventual back-to-back champion Florida Panthers. That kind of season fuels confidence, and GM Steve Staios has every reason to believe his roster is close to complete. Deadline additions Dylan Cozens and Fabian Zetterlund, plus Jordan Spence from the draft, helped spark a 1452 run to close the seasonthe NHLs second-best record over that stretch. That locked up the final Eastern Conference wild card spot with ease. So, if last spring was a test drive, this season could be when Ottawa finally takes the wheeland floors it.

Why you should trust us

This guide comes from the firsthand experience of CableTV.com contributor Ian McLaren. As an Ontario-based hockey writer who grew up in Ottawa, he knows the challenges of following a small-market team nestled between Toronto and Montreal.

To create this guide, Ian compared TV and streaming platforms to help fans find the most consistent and affordable ways to follow their team. Before publishing, he carefully reviewed the 2025–2026 NHL broadcast lineup to ensure Sens fans get the most accurate viewing info available.

Our entire team is committed to this level of detail, and you can learn more about our methods on our How We Rank page.

Which channels have San Diego Padres games?

You can stream all in-market San Diego Padres games with a PADRES.TV subscription. Select games will also air nationally on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, and TBS, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live beyond the Padres’ TV market, you can get an MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS subscription for out-of-market access to all games that air on PADRES.TV.

How much does PADRES.TV cost?

To start the 2025 season, PADRES.TV is available for $19.99 per month or $99.99 for the whole season. This subscription lets you stream all in-market San Diego Padres games live and on demand. Of course, you must live within the team’s broadcast territory, which includes portions of California, Arizona, Nevada, New Mexico, and Hawaii.

If you live in those regions but prefer traditional cable or satellite TV, you can watch in-market games on the MLB San Diego Padres TV channel via DIRECTV, Spectrum TV, or Cox.

For fans outside the Padres’ home market, MLB.TV continues to offer out-of-market coverage. But keep in mind that national blackouts apply to PADRES.TV and MLB.TV when Padres games air exclusively on channels like FOX, FS1, and Apple TV+.

You can watch a handful of Padres Spring Training games for free on PADRES.TV through the MLB app. But as for the 2025 regular season, your best free options are with an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV, or a free streaming trial.

An OTA antenna gives you unrestricted access to all San Diego Padres games aired on FOX. To watch The Friar’s games on FOX for free every season going forward, make sure to grab a highly-rated antenna.

If you create an account on MLB.com, you can watch several Padres games during the regular season at no cost with Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Check each morning which MLB game is streaming free that day.

Our last-at-bat suggestion is to hop on a free live TV streaming trial with DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo. Then, you can stream free MLB games for up to one week.

item.title: How to Watch Freeforms 31 Nights of Halloween in 2025
item.dc:creator: Olivia Bono
item.description:
The 31 Nights of Halloween are back! From October 131, youll be able to enjoy your favorite spooky classics every day on the Freeform channel.

The post How to Watch Freeforms 31 Nights of Halloween in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free on Fubo

The 31 Nights of Halloween are back! From October 1–31, you’ll be able to enjoy your favorite spooky classics every day on the Freeform channel.

This year’s schedule promises spooky skeletons, grinning ghouls, and ferocious frights galore. Keep reading to learn more about what to expect—and how you can tune in.

Don’t let buffering kill your spooky vibes

Enter your zip code below to see faster internet providers in your area.

What are Freeform’s 31 Nights of Halloween?

Since 2018, Freeform (the channel formerly known as ABC Family) has rung in the spooky season by celebrating all 31 nights of Halloween. Yes, all 31—that’s the entire month of October.

It’s like the 25 Days of Christmas, but make it spooky. You can expect schedules packed with some of the biggest Halloween classics.

This year, Freeform’s “31 Nights of Halloween” will include Halloweentown, Tim Burton’s The Nightmare Before Christmas, Beetlejuice, Hocus Pocus (and Hocus Pocus 2), and Edward Scissorhands, just to name a few.

Where to watch Freeform’s 31 Nights of Halloween

The 31 Nights of Halloween air exclusively on Freeform. To watch, you need a cable TV or live streaming TV package that carries Freeform. Luckily, it’s a pretty common channel and available with most plans.

Calling all the monsters. . . .

Do you love the creepy crawly things that go bump in the night? You’ll fit right in here. Check out our #Bloodstream hub for all things spooky and scary.

TV plans that include Freeform

We’ve compiled a list of just a few plans that include Freeform in their channel lineups. We’ve included a variety of TV services and deals (free trials, cheap plans, wide availability, etc.) so you can get the right plan for you.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

This year, in-market games will continue airing on Marquee Sports Network—the exclusive home for Cubs action since 2020. Marquee is available as a standalone streaming subscription and through various TV providers, ensuring local fans get the best coverage.

With renewed energy and the potential for a playoff push, it’s time to rally behind the Cubbies. Keep reading to learn how to watch the Chicago Cubs live on TV this season, from Wrigley Field showdowns to thrilling road games.

Jump to:

  • Chicago Cubs channels
  • Chicago Cubs TV schedule
  • Chicago Cubs Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Chicago Cubs for free

Don’t miss the Chicago Cubs on TV

Gear up for yearlong baseball action, from Spring Training to the World Series. Enter your zip code below to see the best TV and internet providers in your area.

What channels have Chicago Cubs games?

Most Chicago Cubs games air locally on Marquee Sports Network, except for select nationally televised matchups. Those games air nationwide on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

Out-of-market viewers need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the Marquee Sports Network games. But some out-of-market matchups also stream on ESPN+.

Pro tip: MLB At Bat has home and away audio broadcasts of every Chicago Cubs game without blackout restrictions. You can also listen to games on select AM and FM stations across the Midwest via the Chicago Cubs Radio Network.

2025 Chicago Cubs playoff TV schedule

The Chicago Cubs began the 2025 season with the two-game MLB Tokyo Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers at Tokyo Dome in Japan. After the brief international tour, the Cubs returned stateside for more preseason action before the regular season proper began on March 27.

As the season unfolds, you can expect thrilling matchups against National League rivals and American League powerhouses. So, mark your calendars because we’ve laid out the full TV schedule below, complete with start times and channel listings.

The games to watch right now are part of the best-of-three National League Wild Card series against the San Diego Padres.

How to watch Chicago Cubs Spring Training games

Marquee Sports Network will broadcast the majority of the Chicago Cubs’ Spring Training games, including most Sloan Park matchups. Depending on your location, select games may also air live on MLB Network.

The 2025 Cactus League kicks off on Thursday, February 20, when the Cubs take on the Los Angeles Dodgers. I’m especially excited about this matchup since the Cubs and Dodgers will face off again in mid-March during the MLB Tokyo Series.

With a jam-packed spring schedule featuring 29 games—including split-squad contests, exhibition matches in Tokyo, and two MLB Spring Breakout games—this preseason promises plenty of action to gear us up for the regular season. Check out the full Cubs Spring Training TV schedule below.

You can use an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to catch some Chicago Cubs games on FOX for free this season. Antennas aren’t free, but you don’t need a TV subscription. Just use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to check your area’s channels. Then, visit our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations like the Mohu Leaf 50, which is ideal for suburban households.

Another viewing option is the Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Create an account on MLB.com to stream a free game each day of the regular season, but be aware of potential regional blackouts.

You can also try a free live TV streaming trial from services like DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Our top pick for MLB action is DIRECTV STREAM, which has core national channels and most RSNs—including Marquee Sports Network and Chicago Sports Network.

How to watch the Chicago Cubs FAQ

What streaming service has Chicago Cubs games?

Most live TV streaming services have Cubs games, but DIRECTV STREAM is our favorite because of its national and in-market coverage. MLB.TV is available for streaming out-of-market games, while Apple TV+ shows exclusive matches.

How can I watch Marquee without cable?

You can watch Marquee Sports Network without cable via a standalone online subscription for $19.99 per month. The channel is also available through DIRECTV STREAM and Fubo, but you must live within the Cubs TV territory to watch live in-market games.

Can I watch Cubs games on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Cubs fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video by getting an MLB.TV subscription through Prime Video Channels.

Are Cubs games on Sling TV?

Yes, you can watch nationally televised Cubs games on Sling TV. But youll need the Sling Orange + Blue plan to get ESPN and FOX Sports channels together. MLB Network and MLB Network Strike Zone are available in the Sports Extra add-on.

Where can I watch the Iowa Cubs game?

Some Iowa Cubs games air on Marquee Sports Network. But most Minor League Baseball games stream on MLB At Bat via MLB.TVincluding most matchups featuring the Cubs Triple-A affiliate.
